interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/08/17 Average Rating: 3.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Robert McCallum', 'Jordan C. Morris'], 'Producers': ['Robert McCallum', 'Jordan Christopher Morris', 'Marc Almond', 'Matt Miller', 'Sarah Mulholland', 'Kelly Tessier', 'Rodney Waschka II', 'Tim Wendel'], 'Starring': ['Robert McCallum', 'Chris Byford'], 'Studio': ['Pyre Productions']} Review Text: I enjoyed it fine while watching it, but looking at the reviews afterward I have to agree with the points made in the 1 star reviews. The mom wasn't 'missing.' She walked out on her two kids and chose to not make contact again. She was found in a few days and wasn't living far from her parents. She wasn't abducted or anything like that as the title would imply.

There is little to no mystery here. It's a feel-good documentary, but it has very little substance.

I seriously wonder what awards this could have won. Review Title: Not recommended Rating: 2.0 --------------------------------------------------
